result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus C. ALLEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus C. ALLEN
Current: 1280 Wittmann Place #5, Menasha, WI 54952 United States  (Effective: 08-06-2014)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

At 12:17 p.m., $200.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, bail jumping.  Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 4, 4th degree sexual assault.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.  Motion granted.
Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report, along with a Psycho-Sexual Evaluation (or its equivalent), be completed by DOC.
PSI is due to the court by 10-10-14.
Sentencing is set for 10-24-14 at 10:00 a.m.
The parties stipulate to amending the bail from $2,500.00 cash to $200.00 cash.  The Court grants the parties request and orders cash bail in the amount of $200.00 with the conditions previously outlined and adding the condition that he have no contact with any grade schools.  Also, the defendant shall report by Noon instead of 5:00 p.m.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy to jail.  Copy filed.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant in custody.
The parties argue the motion.
The Court modifies the cash bail to $2,500.00 with the following conditions:
-	The defendant is to have no contact with Ashley Leonard and Danielle Stelz;
-	The defendant must reside with his mother at 1280 Wittmann Place #5, Menasha, WI;
-	The defendant must report to the Menasha City Police Department, daily, by 5:00 p.m.
The Court instructs Attorney Scharenbroch to check with Menasha City Police Department to make sure they will do this for Manitowoc County.  She is to update the Court if there is any problem with the reporting condition.
(Attorney Scharenbroch called later and informed the Court that Menasha City PD will honor this condition of bail and allow the defendant to report there daily.)
Minutes.
and Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-17-14 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The defendant is being charged with the crimes of bail jumping and two counts 4th degree sexual assault.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-14-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department daily, by 5:00 p.m. and that he have no contact with Ashley Leonard and Danielle Steltz.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
